benchmark_details.name: Multimodal Academic Cover benchmark (MAC)
benchmark_details.overview: MAC is a live benchmark that dynamically evolves alongside scientific advancements to evaluate multimodal large language models' (MLLMs) scientific understanding capabilities, leveraging over 25,000 image-text pairs from leading scientific journals.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of the MAC benchmark is to continuously assess MLLMs' ability to comprehend implicit scientific concepts in cover images and associated stories.

data.source: Sourced from the official websites of leading scientific journals including Nature, Science, and Cell.
data.annotation: Curated through live curation mechanisms by experts.

methodology.calculation: Measured based on model predictions against the correct image-text pair associations.
methodology.interpretation: Accuracy reflects models' ability to identify correct scientific concepts while ECE measures prediction reliability.
methodology.validation: Annual performance assessments to gauge evolving comprehension and reasoning of MLLMs.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Compliance with open access policies of journal publishers.
